title: Session 4
description: Data preparation and how to go from Luminex machine to covidClassifyR Shiny app
contents:
Description:
In this session you will go over how to prepare your data and upload your data to the covidClassifyR app, and how to check the Luminex run info, raw data file and user-supplied plate layout
 Session details:
11th March 2022, 08:30-09:00am GMT+10
 Materials:

 Slides Recording

Acknowledgments
This workshop was designed for researchers from the Papua New Guinea Institute for Medical Research and partner institutions, and led by Dr. Shazia Ruybal-Pesántez, Dr. Maria Ome-Kaius and Dr. Fiona Angrisano.
Funding for this workshop was provided by a Regional Collaborations Programme COVID-19 Digital Grant from the Australian Academy of Science and Australian Department of Industry, Science, Energy and Resources.

title: Session 5
description: How to perform quality control of your data using the covidClassifyR app
contents:
Description:
In this session you will go over how to perform quality control of your data using the covidClassifyR app and how to interpret the automated quality control plots.
 Session details:
11th March 2022, 09:00-09:30-am GMT+10
 Materials:

 Slides Recording

Funding for this workshop was provided by a Regional Collaborations Programme COVID-19 Digital Grant from the Australian Academy of Science and Australian Department of Industry, Science, Energy and Resources.

title: Session 6
description: Download your quality control report and processed data
contents:
Description:
In this session you will go over how to download your processed data and quality control report and how to interpret them.

title: Session 1
description: Introduction to the SARS-CoV-2 Luminex multi-antigen serology assay
contents:
Description:
In this session you will go over the theory of the multi-antigen Luminex assay and tips on how to set up your assay in the lab.
 Session details:
10th March 2022, 8:30-09:00am GMT+10

title: Session 2
description: Introduction to the COVID-19 serological surveys that have been conducted in PNG
contents:
Description:
In this session you will be introduced to the purpose of serosurveillance research and programs and will go over the COVID-19 serological surveys that have been conducted in PNG.
 Session details:
10th March 2022, 09:00-09:30am GMT+10
 Materials:
Note: this session includes unpublished data, so to maintain confidentiality the materials will be provided to participants directly.
